website_summaries.verdict: This traction pad set is a little smaller than name brands, but it gets the job done.
pros: 3-piece traction pad set made of marine-grade, ultralight diamond grooved EVA foam.Place any way you like –  spread them out for wider boards, put them together for narrower ones
Does not scrape up the skin
cons: Comes off if torn, but not without a lot of force

customer_reviews.title: Squishy, high arch
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Has a very high arch and my foot is pretty low arch, so I don't love it. Worse yet, It has a really soft feel, much softer than a dakine or creatures or Oam pad, so it feels squishy and not solid under my foot. It doesn't give me a confidence that I can push the tail, so I am going to take it off and get a dakine pad. The material is fine and stickiness is fine
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii T

customer_reviews.title: Low-cost, high performance alternative pads.
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was quick, and as promised. Pads were very light, die-cutting was excellent. Genuine 3M backing! Installation was easy. The backing was fresh and came off without tearing or hanging up. I did both nose and tail-block on my mid-size as I spend time on both ends. Trimming up was easy with scissors on the nose, while the tail piece fit without alteration. I'll add content after I've had a few months in the water...OK...Several trips and no issues with peeling or tearing. Nice feel underfoot and , coincidentally, a good reference for best body position while paddling. Looks to be a really good product to date.
customer_reviews.author: gutthans

customer_reviews.title: Good customer support
customer_reviews.text: I received 2 sets of the side pieces instead of 1 set and a middle set. Put it on anyways so u wouldn't miss any sessions waiting for another to show up. Edit: Garbage from start to finish. Sent two sets of the outside pads. Applied anyways for a trip with some friends and 2 of them started peeling up 15 minutes in. Would not recommend. Spend the extra $15 and get a name brand pad. Edit 2: Company contacted me and offered a full refund or a replacement. Timely refund and good customer support. Your mileage may vary with the product, but mine was just not up to par.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan LeFebvre

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just like any deck pad. Cant even tell the difference. However, we'll see how long it lasts. I will up date this after a few months of surfing. I let the pad cure for 72 hours before taking it surfing. Update: 2 months if solid summer surfing. Still on and doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Rater

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected, measure it out before buying. Adhesion is strong, but the black foam at the back is not flush with the white foam, leaving a gap underneath the seam where the adhesive goes onto the board. Survived one day in the water so far. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel S.

customer_reviews.title: great product for the money.  Supporting a small business with great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy but c'mon...surf traction pads are just foam and adhesive. This one is well made and a steal for the price and you are supporting a small business that cares. I used on my electric skateboard to add shape to the deck and works great. I am also a surfer and have bought many traction pads over the years. Just as good as one you would pay $50-60 for.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin P.

customer_reviews.title: Really happy to have an option that is less expensive and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to try out. And I've used it a few times. So I bought 2 more for my other boards. Material is soft by your feet stick well too it. It appears to stick well. It seems similar to a tail pad I had from DaKine which was falling apart after a few years. Really happy to have an option that is less expensive and doesn't have the corporate branding. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a quality pad
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a quality pad. smaller in size so recommended for 6 foot shortboards or skimboards but if you can get outside slivers from other traction pads and space this one out properly it will create a solid pad for a funboard shape board. Has a good enough angle on the end to secure foot holding and enough to give you pop when needed. is a great starter pad and is a good enough price that buying ones in the future to figure out the best placement for the pad won't break your wallet. would recommend to a friend (and I like my friends FYI)
customer_reviews.author: James Vigeant

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive trac pad?  we'll see
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it in the water yet, but doesn't feel like its going to come off anytime soon. The pad is a little smaller than name brand trac pads I have, but I think its a good size. Just got a new board and figured I'd try one of these since its about half the price of buying a pad from a surf shop. Seemed weird when it arrived in a plastic bag with no cardboard, but they do that to be eco-friendly and save money on shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Sandoz

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: Nice track pad for a surf board or skin board. This one was for a skin board I used but it has held up great, grip is nice and adhesion has been strong for about 8 months now with regular use on the weekends.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly the type of "ripping" I was looking for.. pad broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Price for the traction pad is very fair, but does not do any good if it breaks after two uses in the water. I am not even sure how this happened. I looked at my board after coming out of the water and saw the tail had ripped off. I do not surf any gnarly waves that hollow out into barrels over shallow reefs either. I noticed this product says lifetime guarantee but I am unable to find any way to contact the company for a replacement. I hope they are able to see this and reach out for a fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just got myself a new shortboard. Little banged up so i did some repairs and decided to replace the traction pad. As i didnt have much money i decided on this one as it looks like it will do the trick. Put it on my board and it works perfectly and is so far sticking to the board well. For the money there is nothing better. Just didnt want to spend twice the money for a big brand launch pad that does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive didn't hold up through the first two sessions. All 3 pieces fell off and now I can't get a refund because I can't return what is now trash floating in the ocean. Double whammy, not happy, won't buy again from this buyer.
customer_reviews.author: GLB

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this stomp pad
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. I put this stomp pad on my board and the middle one fell off the first time I took it out in the water and the other two sections are peeling up. Pay a little more and get one that actually will stay on your board.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Fell off after two sessions
customer_reviews.text: Fell off after just two sessions. Doesn’t seem to stick to my board. I cleaned the board with isopropanol before applying to make sure there is no residual wax.
customer_reviews.author: John Tan

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice made!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this product. No advertising on the pad was a plus for me too! I cleaned the board with wax remover, after that I used a clean rag and water to make a clean base for the glue, let it dry completley, applied the pad and let it set for 24 hours for a solid application. The pad has a good feel to it and works great for throwing buckets! I have referred a couple of my bros in the water and I am seeing them show up in the lineup. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Not so sticky
customer_reviews.text: Only had it installed one week and one of the panels lifted. I had to buy contract cement to adhere it back to my board.
customer_reviews.author: KampInMyHaus

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This traction pad is every bit as good as the expensive ones. I have been using it for about 2 months on my shortboard (5'11' fish).
customer_reviews.author: scottyrates

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works exactly like the ones you buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price, works exactly like the ones you buy from a surf shops, but at a MUCH better price. I now buy them by the pair in different colors so that I can mix and match them. Mixing the black with the blue looks great on my boards.
customer_reviews.author: Alt Kagesa

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Could be packaged better, mine came a little bent but stuck on well and still works good after many saltwater sessions
customer_reviews.author: bigD0880

customer_reviews.title: The first time I took it out the bottom left corner peeled up
customer_reviews.text: I like the color it matches my board but I had to superglue the corner down after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: chaba Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Got to get out and give them a try.
customer_reviews.text: I have stuck them on my epoxy board. Have not been out to see how they work. I was a little disappointed by how thin they are, but that might be a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Beastwhite

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traction pad.. just as good as one from a surf shop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last minute because I didn't have time to visit a surf shop before my trip to Puerto Rico. I was very skeptical about purchasing a traction pad from Amazon but it met/exceeded my expectations. I put it on about 24 hours before the board was in the water in PR. It help up the entire week and was very comfortable. Did not peel up at all. I expect this traction pad to last a long time. Just an FYI to other buyers, it is a little bit smaller than other tractions pads such as Dakine but the size difference was so minimal it was not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping, Great Price, and Sticks Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son in law, he was telling me he put it on the night of delivery (which was really quick, maybe two days) and the next day it worked perfectly he said. A month later and it's still sticking great. I know in the past he has mentioned other traction pads come off even after a few surfs or start to peel on the edges or what not, but he was saying this traction pad from punt surf is great and has no issues. Great product for a great price, I'll be buying my own trac-pads from here now. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sanelli

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Lets be real. There are a TON of traction pads out there, ranging in price from cheap to "why does a piece of rubber cost that much?!?!?!". This was AMAZING. quality material for a reasonable and fair price. Also, they emailed me upon receiving it and making sure that everything was to my liking and had arrived in one piece, so right off the bat, you know the customer service is on your side. I hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Small

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Boards
customer_reviews.text: Quick from order to application. Trims to customized size. Looks great! This order was for a bellyboard but will get another for long board's nose and tail. The only improvement was lack of instructions - apparently didn't need any - just to make sure of set time and any other issues. Come on, dudes, I'm an ol' shop teacher and like specs and written fodder :)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for the price. It's a little on the narrow side, so if you have a really wide tail (anything above 15 1/2"...mines 15 1/4") you might want to get something else. On a standard shortboard though it gets the job done for half the price. Tailpads have become ridiculously over priced in my opinion...$40 for a few strips of grip is outrageous. Comparable to any of the big names out there...stuck on my board fine...I know some people complained about it peeling off. Maybe the first batch of these had bad glue, but I got mine in September 2014 and it sticks fine.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Osburn

customer_reviews.title: surfing the big island with these on four of our ...
customer_reviews.text: surfing the big island with these on four of our boards... I would buy again... in fact just did for a winter quiver
customer_reviews.author: winton h nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pad, great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent traction pad for my new custom board. I had it made in light blue and the blue pad looks awesome on it. Good traction, heel stop, & a wide arch on the middle pad. It was very affordable (half the price for a similar unit at any surf shop), at my door in 2 days, & packaged well. I have recommended this unit to my crew & plan on buying another for my next freshy
customer_reviews.author: poka

customer_reviews.title: good one
customer_reviews.text: Put it on my 5'10" and it works fine. No need spend more dollars because of a name on it. Same glue. thanks Punt Surf
customer_reviews.author: don from the islands

customer_reviews.title: Good value - but center bump is too hard!
customer_reviews.text: The good news: Install it properly and it will stay on. Been surfing on this for 9 months now, no problems. Good price, looks good. Bad news: The bump in the center feels like I'm standing on a rock, it's uncomfortable under my back foot. It doesn't have any cushion or "give" like a DaKine pad does. So, if you are wuss like me I'd say pay a few extra bucks for another pad.
customer_reviews.author: DSLR filmer

customer_reviews.title: good but not for us
customer_reviews.text: Good product just wasnt exactly what we were looking for... The heel in back of adhesive was to high so it kept getting in way.
customer_reviews.author: csimon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a month until the back part of the middle section came off.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and got the job done at first, but the back part of the middle cushion came off of the board all of a sudden. I’ve never had this happen with a stomp pad before, so pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great traction pad, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical but it blew away my expectations. The grippiness is great and the pad is light. I'm pretty amazed that you can find a traction pad of this quality for this prize, it performed way better then some $40 pads I've used. EDIT Feb 17, 2015: My board is all dinged up now, but this traction pad is still going strong. Someone in the lineup says that PUNT SURF manufactures their traction pads at the same factories as Dakine and Creatures of Leisure. I don't doubt that!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Westin

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable Traction Pad
customer_reviews.text: I cut off the tail block portion of the traction pad. That is the only portion I like to use. Companys do make and sell tail block pads, but they are hard to find and are usually the same price or more than your complete pad. I put the middle portion of the tail block on one surfboard and the side portions on another board. I took care of two boards for the price of one. Thanks for your reasonably priced quality product. It fit my needs perfectly. ps. I'm sure I will find some use for the portions of the pad that I cut off ..... maybe for safety in the bath tub....
customer_reviews.author: Gary Choy

customer_reviews.title: Far Out!
customer_reviews.text: I ripped the waves. I got some serous air with these traction pads. I bought pads double the price. But these out perform them. My cutbacks have improved and I am like a freaking action figure on a mounting stand. I won't fall off boards and flying Down the line like the silver surfer!
customer_reviews.author: JackReview

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome. As good as any other pad
customer_reviews.text: It’s awesome. As good as any other pad, and literally half the price. I don’t know why anyone would have anything bad to say about this... they are great!
customer_reviews.author: TaylortheWhaler

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: Product looks great, easy to install, and exceeded expectations. Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: TMAC

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Although it did not come packaged like most tail pads , it seems to be just as good as the $ 35.00 ones for half the price !!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Carulli

customer_reviews.title: Best Traction Pad For the Money
customer_reviews.text: This traction is fantastic. I have it on about 5 boards. Super high quality. It uses the same materials,and same adhesive as the expensive brand name pads, but without having to pay the extra bucks. Now they just need to start making leashes too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kuzma

customer_reviews.title: very sticky, great quality
customer_reviews.text: very good for the price, adhesive is very strong, less expensive then other brands, and same quality
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra L.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, not super sticky but easy fix.
customer_reviews.text: This is good looking, a nice snow white. The only problem is that I had to buy glue, as one corner wouldn't stay in place. This is a minor inconvenience. It's comfortable though and doesn't give me a rash like some of the really stiff ones.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and customer service from seller.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked is the sellers follow up with the customer to make sure they are satisfied with the purchase. Great quality and great customer service. Will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Don't last as long as more expensive traction pads.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these within a couple month period of time for 3 different surf boards. All of them the pads fell off within 18 months +/- a couple of months. The frustrating part is that it wasn't the adhesive that failed, it was the pads themselves ripping away from the board and leaving a time consuming mess to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Wrenne

customer_reviews.title: I need to buy more pad like material to cover where my foot is placed
customer_reviews.text: Very small pad, doesn't cover as much of an area as other traction pads. Color wasn't even close to what was pictured either. I need to buy more pad like material to cover where my foot is placed. Wouldn't buy another for sure.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYoung

customer_reviews.title: Skimmer board!
customer_reviews.text: This is for my 8 year old grandson I purchased the board but they were out of traction pads. It was very important to come fast and Amazon did it. He was very happy with the traction pad. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to peel off and install. Still holding together well and no issues after the first big surf day
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for a great price. Can't beat it. I received my stomp pad on Friday and have used it twice since. Very simple to install. It has great grip and is soft which makes a full day of surfing that much more enjoyable. I also purchased a second one as a gift for my sister she has yet to use it but is really stoked on the color and the look. With these pads there's really no reason to spend $40+ on a stomp pad unless you really need a logo on yours.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to skimboard
customer_reviews.text: The green matched my sons Zap skimboard really well. It was easy to stick on and the grip allowed him to do more tricks at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Dawne Kakitsis

customer_reviews.title: Came off in  less than 15 minutes in the water
customer_reviews.text: Complete rubbish. I carefully cleaned and dried my board before sticking it on. Within two minutest in the water the back was coming unstuck, ant then I completely lost the middle piece when a big wave hit the board. $20 and it lasted less that 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Sturt

customer_reviews.title: good stuuf
customer_reviews.text: I think I have about 5 of these on various boards in the family - no issues, still well, feel great, no paying surf shop close to the beach tax, I play plenty where i live thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryanator

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This company makes awesome, good quality stuff, and on top of that their customer service is impeccable!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: I use Punt Surf traction on my surfboards and appreciate never having to deal with wax anymore. It stays on quite well and provides the perfect amount of traction.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCroskey

customer_reviews.title: Glue separated from pad. Disappointed cause its a nice traction pad.
customer_reviews.text: The pad looks great, and my feet stick to it well. Feels good underneath my feet, but the glue has seperated from the pad. I know this because the glue is still stuck on the board while the pad is peeling off, so it wasn't user error.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: did not adhere very well....
customer_reviews.text: received traction pad with a small section of 3M paper adhesive off - so no bueno...after one use, it came off and was unusable for the rest of my session which bummed out my day:( i guess maybe find another one....
customer_reviews.author: lalinde_dp

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst traction pad I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these traction pads because they were so cheap and I guess you get what you pay for....All five peeled off within a couple sessions. By far the worst traction pad I've owned. Sticking with Dakine and Gorilla from now on. Now It's going to be more of a pain to take off and put on another one...save yourself the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Winner winner
customer_reviews.text: Totally radical! But seriously.. .. Nice track top, 3m glue, nice foot arch, solid kick and........ Super cheap. Be sure to sand and clean before you apply for a lasting quality, number 1 product!
customer_reviews.author: cabbage brain

customer_reviews.title: Good Pad, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Good, inexpensive piece of traction that feels good under foot and sticks to the board well. The pad overall is a little narrow for more the modern Flyers / Rockets / sub-performance boards (I spread it out a bit and leave 2 small gaps), wish there was an option from this company for a little wider one.
customer_reviews.author: ccru

customer_reviews.title: and attached easily and has worked out so far
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly, and attached easily and has worked out so far, Very Happy for a simple traction pad.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stomp pad
customer_reviews.text: These are stomp pads are a great value. This one went on a surfboard and is working like a champ. I have also used them on skimboards with no problems. The adhesive is strong and the pad is a nice thickness.
customer_reviews.author: YourNameHere

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and good price
customer_reviews.text: This works and looks just as nice as some of the pricier ones. Okay so it's only one color, but it matches the blue on my board and I don't like too much "flash." Only been a couple weeks using but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Doozapa

customer_reviews.title: Great Short Board Pad
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a high performance short board. Excellent arch support. I love this pad, and it is less than half the cost of a brand name pad. Professional grade. For a team rider price. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kuzma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped with minimal packaging, but arrived in great shape. This is as easy to put on as any other traction pad, but at half the price. It works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great traction pad at a great price. Friendly messages from this small company accompanied the delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Backus

customer_reviews.title: They did what they were made to do.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing great nothing bad...they did what they were made to do. This is what my son said.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Good for inflatable SUP
customer_reviews.text: got them to have more control turning with my 14ft inflatable SUP , so far so good after a week of use
customer_reviews.author: Tristan S.

customer_reviews.title: Mean Green
customer_reviews.text: Great pad used on one of my backup race board. The green is neon green and stands out. Functions like it should.
customer_reviews.author: BPUNZ Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great traction pad.
customer_reviews.text: Sweet traction pad! Its not to thick and is nice and soft but still responsive. This is definitely the best value traction pad on the market, pick up a few for your arsenal of boards!
customer_reviews.author: Jared L

customer_reviews.title: plain black trac pad
customer_reviews.text: i was not looking for graphics or big logos, and in that regard, this is perfect. i just needed a plain black trac pad, and this gets the job done. i cleaned my board good before applying, and so far, so good. i would not hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: jamieg1221

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I shouldn't have gotten it wet?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Can't really review it since it lasted me only 3 sessions, I applied it as carefully as possible but just didn't seem to last as long as the other traction pads.
customer_reviews.author: maarcoooo

customer_reviews.title: legit
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my skim board and also bought the punt 34x9 grip mat. I cut the grip 34x9 grip mat into 3 pieces and matches so perfect with this traction pad.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I really like this traction pad
customer_reviews.text: I really like this traction pad. it's exactly what I as hoping for. I really like the raised up section in on the middle pad. I'm newer to surfing so it also helps with making sure my foot isn't too far back.
customer_reviews.author: B. George

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. I bought this for my cousin's birthday ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I bought this for my cousin's birthday and my son liked it so much that I bought another for him. I also appreciated the follow up email from the supplier asking if I was happy with purchase. I wish all companies were that eager to provide customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mario R.

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty small.
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty small... Good for groms or beginners, but just make sure to look at the measurements before you purchase. Customer service is top notch
customer_reviews.author: DGK

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent traction pad. be careful to clean the board extremely well before attaching it. I probably didn't and I lost a piece of it in the water and had to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Perry993

customer_reviews.title: I don't know that it should come with instructions but it probably wouldn't be a bad idea.
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly on my son's skim born. Peel off the back stick it on. We went on YouTube to find out how to lineup and apply it. I don't know that it should come with instructions but it probably wouldn't be a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Esther Dabney

customer_reviews.title: Great Traction!
customer_reviews.text: I put it on a skimboard that I had sitting in my garage and wasn't using very much. I mostly Wakesurf now so with this on my old skimboard I am able to get a good grip on the board. It's a good size and is in three parts which helps you customize the way you want to position it on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: not too shabby!
customer_reviews.text: i thought the slightly higher than usual back would make this thing come off quickly... but it hasnt yet... and no more slipping off the back of my fish and ankle hurty!
customer_reviews.author: Ryanator

customer_reviews.title: Can't find a better deal out there...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works just like any other traction pad, but for half the price! That's awesome. Very pleased. If you don't care about having some super trendy and cool design or color scheme, save yourself the cash and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: They're great.. Punt surf is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Been using these about a year now no issues.. Just put a new one my new board yesterday.. Have about 6 back ups.. They're great.. Punt surf is awesome.. might try some of they're fins..
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Need full product
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a great product and feels great. It sticks well to the board and gives an optimal surf experience, however when I received my product I only got two of the three parts to the pad luckily my old middle pad was ok from my last Trac pad, I just feel that I over payed sense I didn't get the full product, dissapointing in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Campbell

customer_reviews.title: One star
customer_reviews.text: I have been surfing for 30 yrs and never had a deck pad come off on me. Very disappointed in the product and that a perfect surf session was ruined cause the pad starting coming off after it got wet. Board was brand new, never waxed and preped before putting on deck pad.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Banse Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid pad
customer_reviews.text: Great pad and unbeatable price. It does what it's supposed to do, adheres well, provides good traction and comfortable underfoot.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Just got that for my son. He thinks is happy with the product and thinks is the perfect size for his surfboard. Hwvr he didn’t got a chance to use it yet
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Quality without the brand name hype
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a stand-up paddle board with carbon fiber. And this helped compliment the board colors. But not only that, it has a very sticky "death grip" compared to some of the other big brands out there. Quality product indeed. I will be building more boards in the near future and I will be coming back to purchase more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sprayscience

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for super cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great pad for super cheap! Just used it today in the water and worked fine, secured to my board no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hayduke

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Great color and still stuck on the surfboard
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Great color and still stuck on the surfboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lanzo

customer_reviews.title: This pad is great, way cheaper than anything from Dakine or COL
customer_reviews.text: This pad is great, way cheaper than anything from Dakine or COL, but just as good. Nothing odd or funky about it, just a plain white pad that feels great on the foot and is still stuck on my board after some macking waste high waves came through and tested it out this week. 3m product, I'm sure it will be good in bigger waves too:)
customer_reviews.author: TheKelsays

customer_reviews.title: great price on a traction pad that works well
customer_reviews.text: great price on a traction pad that works well. Not as fancy as Da Kine or Kommunity, but fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grip Pads
customer_reviews.text: These grip pads are awesome! Super easy to install, and the shipping was quick! Thanks Punt Surf!
customer_reviews.author: Lemuel Jamorabon

customer_reviews.title: Grip it and rip it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second tail pad from punt surf. Great quality for much less than name brands. Works great and saves money, I will continue to use these on my boards!
customer_reviews.author: stephen kizel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stomp pad
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stomp pad, high quality with strong glue. I was hesitant at first because it was so much cheaper than the big name ones, but it's definitely of equal or superior quality. I dig the basic black, too. No logos or anything, which I love. I hate being a floating da kine billboard.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Orkin

customer_reviews.title: Best value on the market.... Period.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Adhesive is strong, grip is great, and no lame weak spots on the pad that say "Dak...." that would peel off prematurely. Punt pads will be my only source from here out. No one else can match the price to quality ratio!
customer_reviews.author: P the Curr

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for boys. or girls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew for his birthday, he loves it, he has it on his skimboard and was so excited to get it. I would recommend it to anyone has a skimboard
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great traction pad
customer_reviews.text: Great traction pad! I ordered the orange one and it looks great. Feels exactly like a $40 Zap or Future pad. Great deal for anyone looking to ball on a budget lol
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Super value at $19! And, the pad works for me... feels good. The pad is a bit smaller than the Da Kine Launch that I normally use, but I have not had any problems because of the size. I use the board with the pad about once a week for over six months and have not the problem with it coming off.
customer_reviews.author: C Takanishi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Sticks on great and is perfect size, allowing for some misplacement of the foot but still making it on the pad. Has great traction when its wet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Did not stick!
customer_reviews.text: Trac pad came off 15 minutes into my first surf with the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Sticks on great and is perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Sticks on great and is perfect size, allowing for some misplacement of the foot but still making it on the pad. Has great traction when its wet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Great Traction Pad.
customer_reviews.text: Great traction pad for an amazing price. Why pay more for a brand name? No problems with the shipping - came fast and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ryan Grootveld

product_meta.title: PUNT SURF Surfboard Traction Pad - 3 Piece Surf Board & Skimboard Stomp Foot Pad with Arch Bar - 3M Adhesive - Maximum Kick Tail Deck Grip for Surfing & Skimboarding - Sticks Forever on Your Board
feature_bullets: SEE THEIR JAWS DROP: Our traction pad provides the ULTIMATE, LIGHTWEIGHT grip for you. Dig your back foot in with confidence on those critical bottom turns and cutbacks.

FITS ANY SURFBOARD & SKIMBOARD: You can place this 3 piece traction pad as you please. Spread the pieces out for wider boards, put the pieces together for narrower ones. Dimensions: 10.5" x 11.75", 10mm center arch, 25mm tail kick.
UNBEATABLE QUALITY: We only use premium 3M adhesive direct from the source and marine-grade, ultralight diamond grooved EVA foam.

PUNT SURF 100% STOKE GUARANTEE: Our traction pads will stick forever on your board or your money back, no questions asked. We're a homegrown company from California, and our mission is to provide premium surf, skim and SUP accessories for all. We love being in the water, and we're always testing our products to ensure they are the best out there. We're confident you'll be stoked!

LOVE OUR PLANET, CHOOSE PUNT SURF: For us, making premium products for all isn't enough. We are a highly environmentally conscious company that cares about giving back. As a proud member of 1% for the Planet, we donate a portion of every sale to nonprofits dedicated to protecting our oceans and environment.
